data.text:
Top 5 things to do on a trip to St. Catharines

Catch a live performance in The Meridian Centre

Visit Happy Rolph's Bird Sanctuary

Attend a show at the FirstOntario Performing Arts Centre

Go for a tour at Rockway Vineyards

Follow a trail along the Welland Canal

In the Niagara Region, St. Catharines provides a beautiful downtown area with plenty to see and do within walking distance.

If you’ve never been to St. Catharines, you owe yourself a proper adventure of exploring the history and culture it provides.

Numerous tours can help you navigate downtown and there are plenty of parks and sights to explore. Throughout St. Catharines you’ll be able to marvel at historic architecture, have the tough decision of choosing where to eat, visit museums, and much more.

We’ll try to help simplify your trip to St. Catharines by providing some our favourite hotels, shops, and restaurants listed below!

Transportation options in St. Catharines

Our bus to St. Catharines takes you directly to the St. Catharines Bus Terminal on 70 Carlisle St.

Learn more about our most popular routes to St. Catharines.

Upon your arrival, getting around on your trip to St. Catharines will be a breeze. St. Catharines is an easy city to navigate by foot and St. Catharines Transit offers bus routes throughout the city.

In addition, taxis and ride shares make up a major presence in St. Catharines.

Best places to stay in St. Catharines

After your long exhaustive day of sight-seeing, you’re going to need a place to crash. St. Catharines is widely known for its amenities and extensive hotel accommodations.

There are plenty of hotels to choose from, making a trip to St. Catharines accessible for any traveler.

The most lavish hotels in St. Catharines would be Four Points by Sheraton St. Catharines Niagara Suites or the Springbank House, putting you in a central location to many of the city’s sights.

Alternatively, many hotels such as the Capri Inn, Days Inn St. Catharines Niagara, or other rentals are available at a lower cost and offer plenty of travel options for your trip to St. Catharines.

Nightlife in St. Catharines

St. Catharines may seem calm and quaint by day, but get ready to party as hard as Niagara Falls at night.

Make sure to check out The Merchant Ale House if you’re seeking a neighborhood bar stocked with house-made beer and tasty downtown eats.

Another great downtown staple is Celtic Pub. A favourite for locals, you’ll find a robust menu of delicious food and plenty of beers on tap.

For comedy fans, Showtime Comedy and Entertainment is an outstanding venue to round out your St. Catharines trip.

Where to shop on your trip to St. Catharines

There will be no shortage of shopping options while you’re in the limits of the city, whether you’re seeking retail therapy or are looking to bring a slice of St. Catharines home with you.

Right in the heart of downtown St. Catharines, you’ll find over 120 shops, boutiques, and restaurants to choose from.

From its many art galleries and heritage sites, you’ll be within walking distance of all the charm of this beautiful city. In addition, St. Catharines is home to one of the oldest farmers markets in Ontario.

A short distance away, you could find The Pen Centre for all of your retail and luxury shopping needs, boasting over 180 stores.

Best free things to do in St. Catharines

Lakeside Park Beach

Happy Rolph's Bird Sanctuary

St. Catharines Museum and Welland Canal

Lakeside Park Carousel (5 cents)

Folk Arts Festival

Even the most frugal of travelers will find something to love on their trip to St. Catharines. One of the greatest reasons to take a trip to St. Catharines is that many of the attractions are of no cost to you.

Totally free, you owe yourself a trip to Happy Rolph’s Bird Sanctuary to interact with animals and for spectacular views of Lake Ontario.

You can even soak in the culture on your trip to St. Catharines by walking through historic downtown, where it will often be buzzing with activity.
